headline: Mamaw's Chicken and Rice Casserole
description: This chicken and rice casserole is quick and easy to put together and will remind you of your grandma's cooking.

video.description: Nothing is better for a potluck or a weeknight dinner than this easy casserole recipe! In this video, Nicole shows you how to make a homemade chicken and rice casserole with a crumbly cracker crust. Using chopped chicken breast, three creamed soups, and instant rice, compile all of the ingredients into a baking dish. Topped with melted butter, as well as crushed crackers, bake this delicious main course in the oven. It’s easy, quick, and will please even the pickiest eater!
video.name: How to Make Chicken Rice Casserole

name: Mamaw's Chicken and Rice Casserole
recipeIngredient: 1 (10.75 ounce) can cream of chicken soup
1 (10.75 ounce) can cream of celery soup
1 (10.75 ounce) can cream of mushroom soup
salt and ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Grease sides and bottom of a casserole dish.
Stir chicken, water, rice, cream of chicken soup, cream of celery soup, and cream of mushroom soup together in the prepared casserole dish; season with salt and pepper.
Arrange butter evenly over the top of the chicken mixture.
Bake in preheated oven until the rice is tender and the chicken is cooked through, 1 hour to 75 minutes.
Cool 10 to 15 minutes before serving. Enjoy!

review.reviewBody: I was skeptical when I saw 3 cans of soup go into this and I almost deleted it until I read the 1st reviewer which stated my concerns with the soup and that it would have a processed taste which she stated didn't. I decided to try it. I used 50% less fat Land of Lakes Margarine to cut down on the fat. It takes a 3 quart or 9 x 13 in casserole dish which isn't stated in the recipe. I decided to give this a try thinking I would regret it but not only didn't I regret it I LOVED IT. It's fast, easy and it does not have a processed taste which I expected. I warned everyone ahead of time that it might not be great but it was an easy meal. Everyone said "what do you mean it's not great we love it". I have to agree. If you're looking for a relatively fast easy meal that's tasty this one is one you might want too consider. No processed taste at all. It was done in an hour and only prep time really was cutting up the chicken breast. Only change I made was to add some Her*box chicken seasoning (which I think is the best) to the mix. Otherwise I followed the recipe exactly. Most recipes call for the chicken to be cooked prior to baking but this one didn't and I wasn't sure about it but after an hour I pulled a chicken bit out of the center and temperature checked it and it was done. My family really liked this and I will definitely be making this again and again. It's easy and tasty. If you are in need of a fast and tasty meal this one fits the bill.

Overall, recipe is great! Simple, quick, & tasty with minor adjustments. I used chicken broth instead of water, I used two cans of mushroom & 1 can of chicken soup. I also added in chopped broccoli florets with shredded cheese. Lastly, I added more seasonings & spices along with cooked onion& garlic. Tastes amazing!!

Just like mom used to make, and I added diced onion, crushed garlic and some peas and carrots...I used to mix my veggies with the casserole when my mom made it, to make the veggies more palatable. You really can't go wrong with this recipe, and leftover turkey is fantastic in this recipe as well, with some Stove Top Stuffing sprinkled over the top before baking.
I made this, but substituted chicken broth for the water, thighs for the breast, and added a 7oz can of mild chilies. Major flavor enhanced! Jon

Okay so we do it a little different I first cook my chicken in a skillet ahead of time. We also add a bundle of green onions that have been sauteed in butter> I add one envelope of the ranch dip mix also. One cup of shredded cheese and on top halfway through cooking it I add about a cup and a half of seasoned bread crumbs. It's a lot easier it's a lot faster you're looking at about 40 minutes versus the hour and a half since your chicken is already cooked and you're pretty much just getting the rice cooked and everything fully heated.

Easy pleasy. That's what I said 'cause it pleased the family & tweaked it after reading thru some reviews; I added a cup of shredded cheddar, used broth instead of water, seasoned with pepper, sage, oregano, rosemary, cayenne (chili powder), sautéed onions and chopped celery (no celery soup can, just used chicken and mushroom cream soups). Used regular rice at 1 & 1/2 cups. 

The chicken was from a rotisserie chicken, but I threw it in the pan after sautéing the veggies so that it created fond for the taste (that delicious brown stuff that sticks to the pan). 

I cooked everything in a 16 to 18" pot that went uncovered into the oven for 1hr.
Be very careful not to grab the handle barehanded out of the oven. I slip a large potholder over the handle to take it out then leave it on the handle. Leaving it on the handle keeps me aware of the heat and no one gets hurt touching it.

It was great the next day too.

Was so surprised something simple could be so tasty.

My preferred way to make it is to use chicken broth instead of water, add a bit of poultry seasoning, and throw in veggies such as asparagus and sliced mushrooms. Sharp cheddar on top instead of butter is a great ending.

This is great left alone but I wanted to put my own touch on this great comfort food . Instead of 2 cups of water I used 1 water and 1 milk . I also added a hand full or 2 of shredded mild cheddar cheese . I also chopped up some carrots to add some color and because I love carrots . It was a hit with my Wife and parents , so good !!! Thanks

I did use some poultry seasoning on the chicken. Added chicken bouillon to the water. I only used two soups instead of three. I used cream of chicken and broccoli & cheese. Cooked covered for 40 min then put shredded cheese and some breadcrumbs on top and cooked uncovered for 35 minutes. Thought it was way too much butter on top still. Until I let it sit for 15-20min waiting for my biscuits. The butter must have soaked in. But was not greasy at all. The top was a nice brown crispy crust. Turned out great and kiddo loved it. Probably could have used the extra can of soup. It was set pretty good and had good texture. But extra soup probably would make a little creamier.

Great recipe, and so easy! I, like others, used broth instead of water, added seasonings and added a bag of frozen peas & carrots (thawed). I baked it covered in foil except for the last 20 minutes when I added shredded cheddar to the top. My husband, who isn't a chicken fan, loved this and asked me to hang onto the recipe so I can make it again.
This was fantastic! I used half a Spanish onion, fresh broccoli, plenty of cheddar cheese in it and Frenchs Onion crisps on top.

So so good! I did add a couple of additions to this recipe and it turned out amazing. I usually hate when people try a recipe and change it completely and give a negative rating. This is what I did. I added onion powder, garlic powder I cut up a quarter of an onion added it to the mix before baking, then the last 15 minutes of baking time I grated Sharp cheddar cheese, as well as a packet of Ritz crackers, crumbled on top and baked for about 15 more minutes and it turned out amazing!

My picky 7 and 4 year olds LOVED this. I used regular rice so I followed others’ suggestion off doubling the water and it was perfect. I cooked for an hour then sprinkled cheese on top and cooked for another 15 minutes and it was great!

Great recipe! I did not have a cream of celery; so I impervised and used a cream of corn. Regular rice and doubled the water: 2 cups of rice with 4 cups of water. Cooked for an hour and 15 mins uncovered. Perfection!!!!
Does anyone know if I could just freeze this after making it and not baking it and have it later?🤷‍♀️🤷‍♀️🤷‍♀️ this was delicious everyone loved. It will definitely put it in my rotation.

I made this tonight and it’s so tasty, easy to make, and my grown kids loved it. I used 2 cups of chicken broth instead of 2 cups of water and brown minute rice instead of white minute rice. Definitely will make this a lot in the future. Southern comfort food at its finest! Everyone will LOVE this! Thanks for sharing your recipe.
After making this recipe for the first time several years ago, my family requests it all the time!! Absolutely one of our top favorite family meals!!
Easy dish to alter and experiment with.
How can I substitute cooked rice for the instant rice?
